title: Automotive UX Designer
description:
At Cliff Design, we believe that Design is the power that drives change. We are working with project based commitments in our design studio as well as providing design consultants on-site at our clients design departments. We constantly need to be challenged and are always interested in connecting with dedicated creative souls.
  
  

Job DescriptionWe are seeking a talented Automotive UX Designer to join our team. This unique role focuses on creating intuitive and innovative user experiences through the implementation, management, and control of ambient lighting, exterior light communication, interactive surfaces, and other screen based and non-screen-based interactions within our vehicles.Considering the whole scope of UX you are to challenge and innovate the way users interact with the whole eco-system of products and services.
  
Responsibilities and tasks• Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and prioritize requirements for lighting UI features and functionality. Translate user needs and market insights into actionable design requirements.• Create and maintain documentation, including design specifications, requirements, style guides, and user documentation for lighting UI features across several platforms.• Communicate progress and updates to stakeholders in a clear and timely manner.•Develop and maintain a roadmap for lighting UI development, outlining key milestones and deliverables. Prioritise features based on business value, technical feasibility, and user impact.•Provide guidance and direction to UX/UI designers in creating visually appealing and user-friendly lighting interfaces. Ensure consistency and coherence across different lighting applications, platforms, and vehicle models.•Work closely with engineering and development teams to ensure the successful implementation of lighting UI designs. Facilitate communication and collaboration between stakeholders throughout the development process.
  
Requirements• Master's degree in Design, Human-Computer Interaction, Media management or related field.• Relevant working experience within UX for an automotive client.• Good knowledge of the HMI design process and best-practices.• Software such as Figma, Photoshop, After Effects and HTML & CSS.• English, spoken and written.•Proven experience (1-2 years) designing user interfaces for automotive applications.
  
Additional information• In addition to CV we will only consider applications with attached work samples (pdf-design portfolio max 8 Mb file size or a web portfolio link)Deadline for application• 2024-11-04.Selection and interviews will take place continuously. The position may be filled before the closing date, so please apply as soon as possible.

title: Digital product manager
description:
Energy Save is looking for a driven and experienced Digital Product Manager to lead and develop our digital product portfolios. You will play a central role in our growth journey, where you will be responsible for creating innovative digital solutions that meet our customers' needs. This is a unique opportunity for someone who wants to help shape the future in a rapidly growing industry.
  
Responsibilities for the Digital Product Manager
  
  

**In the role of Digital Product Manager, you will:**  

Develop and implement product strategies for our digital products.
  
Analyze market trends and competitors to identify opportunities and threats.
  
Collaborate closely with other functions within the product organization to ensure high-quality product launches as a whole for the company.
  
Use customer insights and feedback to continuously improve products.
  
Lead our digital team through the entire product lifecycle, from idea to launch.
  
Be responsible for the unit’s personnel, budget, and working environment.
  
  

Qualifications and Experience
  
  

**To succeed in this role, you should have:**  

Experience as a Product Owner or Digital Product Manager, preferably within the tech industry.
  
Strong understanding of User Experience (UX) and agile development methods.
  
Experience using data analysis to drive product decisions.
  
Good communication skills and experience working with cross-functional teams.
  
Knowledge and relevant education of tools and techniques for digital product development, such as product roadmaps and requirement management.
  
Fluency in English, both spoken and written.
  
  

Personal Attributes
  
  

**We are looking for someone who is:**  

Visionary with the ability to put strategy into practice.
  
Analytical and data-driven with a passionate interest in digital innovation.
  
Flexible and adaptable to a fast-changing environment.
  
Proactive with a solution-oriented mindset.
  
  

What we offer
  
At Energy Save, you will have the opportunity to work in a dynamic environment where innovation and development are the focus. We offer:
  
A flexible workplace with the possibility of remote work.
  
Supportive colleagues and leaders who encourage personal growth and development.
  
Competitive salary and benefits in accordance with collective agreements.
  
A work culture characterized by collaboration and team spirit.

title: Brand Designer till snabbväxande techföretag i Stockholm!
description:
Dina arbetsuppgifter
  
Vill du vara en nyckelspelare i att forma varumärkesidentiteten för ett innovativt techföretag? Vi söker en passionerad och erfaren Brand Designer som vill vara med på vår resa att skapa och upprätthålla en stark och konsekvent varumärkesidentitet över olika kanaler.
  
  

**Om rollen:** Som Brand Designer kommer du att spela en central roll i vårt marknadsförings- och produktteam, där du får ansvar för att utveckla visuella koncept som speglar våra värderingar och vår vision. Du kommer att arbeta med både digitala och fysiska medier, från digitala kampanjer och sociala medier till webbdesign och tryckmaterial. Här får du möjlighet att vara kreativ och proaktiv, och sätta ditt avtryck i företagets visuella identitet.
  
  

**Ansvarsområden:**  

* Utveckla och implementera varumärkesriktlinjer för en enhetlig kommunikation.
* Skapa visuellt innehåll för digitala annonser, sociala medier, webbdesign och tryckmaterial.
* Samarbeta med marknadsföringsteamet för att utveckla kreativa koncept för kampanjer.
* Leda designprocessen från idé till färdig produkt, inklusive skisser och prototyper.
* Hålla varumärket aktuellt genom att utforska och tillämpa nya designtrender.
* Bidra till en sammanhängande kundupplevelse genom UX-design i digitala plattformar.


**Kvalifikationer:**  

* Minst 3 års erfarenhet inom grafisk design eller brand design, gärna inom techsektorn.
* Stark visuell förståelse och förmåga att kommunicera idéer genom design.
* Erfarenhet av att skapa och implementera designriktlinjer över flera plattformar.
* Erfarenhet av designverktyg som Adobe Creative Suite, Sketch, Figma eller liknande.
* Förmåga att arbeta självständigt och leda designprojekt från start till slut.
* En imponerande portfölj som visar din kreativitet och förmåga att skapa engagerande visuella koncept.


Vi söker en strukturerad och handlingskraftig person med en prestigelös attityd som trivs i en snabbväxande miljö. Om du har en passion för design och ett öga för detaljer samtidigt som du kan leverera under press, är detta rätt plats för dig!
  
  

**Praktisk information:**  

**Plats:** Stockholm
  
**Avdelning:** Marknadsföring
  
**Anställningsgrad:** Heltid
  
**Startdatum:** 6 november 2024
  
  

Låter detta intressant? Skicka in din ansökan idag och bli en del av vårt team!
  
  

Om oss
  
Sway Sourcing är ett modernt företag som rekryterar inom flera branscher på den svenska arbetsmarknaden. Vi matchar kandidaters kompetens och kunskap med företagets behov. Sway Sourcing har en företagsledning och personal med lång erfarenhet i rekryteringsbranschen, både som ägare och anställda. Vi har ett stort nätverk inom de branscher vi specialiserat oss inom och kan därför hitta de kandidater som snabbt blir en tillgång för företagen.

title: Senior Product Manager
description:
**Product Manager to shape the future of Refined for Cloud**
============================================================


Location: Sweden, Malmö


Have you been longing for a role where your initiative and vision can truly impact a globally growing B2B SaaS product?


At Refined, we offer you the canvas to reimagine, innovate, and leave your mark on the future of our SaaS product that revolutionizes site building for Confluence and Jira Service Management. Take a closer look at our product offerings here>>


Right now, we're evolving our product to offer even more powerful and intuitive solutions for companies to manage and share content. This isn't just about enhancing a SaaS product; it's about redefining how all types of companies, especially large enterprises like Apple and Spotify, get more value from their Atlassian instances.


As our new Product Manager or Senior Product Manager, you'll lead this journey, turning complex challenges into simple, value-creating solutions.


Ready to read more?  

  

  



#### **What makes the PM role at Refined unique?**


This role is about leading a change, ensuring that our product provides value and simplicity for our customers. You’ll have the autonomy to lead discovery efforts, turn challenges into opportunities and create intuitive user experiences for diverse use cases. You will have a direct line to our customers and partners, providing unique insights into their needs and how our product can evolve to meet them. Unlike some similar PM roles that may be restricted by tight feature roadmaps, at Refined, we believe in empowering our Product Managers with the freedom to explore, innovate, and solve customer problems. Your day-to-day will be varied, engaging with different teams, talking to customers, and even shaping the product strategy.


By the way, our journey of organic growth and our commitment to a flat hierarchy in a non-VC-backed landscape create a distinctive environment where your expertise is valued. Here, you'll find the autonomy to apply your knowledge creatively, directly influence our product roadmap, and engage in open discussions.

### **Your responsibilities in a nutshell**

* Lead in identifying and planning strategic opportunities, ensuring solutions align with customer needs and product vision. Promote continuous product discovery to foster an iterative approach towards achieving outcomes.
* Ensure team OKRs align with organizational goals through collaboration with other teams and stakeholders. Communicate the significance of your team member's work in relation to business, user needs, and company objectives.
* Facilitate seamless cooperation among PM, Design, and Engineering teams to create solutions that are usable, feasible, and valuable. Keep stakeholders updated on product progress, strategy shifts, and address risks or issues promptly.
* Create and manage a backlog for short/mid-term features and enhancements, prioritizing based on customer value and business impact. Ensure the product roadmap is in sync with internal team goals and Head of Product strategies.

**Your goals and milestones in your first year**
------------------------------------------------

### **In 3 months:**

* Acquire an overall understanding of the Refined products, identifying key areas for improvement and aligning with the broader vision for Refined.
* Begin fostering smooth collaboration with Engineering and Design teams, establishing when and how to involve them in decision-making processes.

### **In 6 months:**

* Develop a deeper understanding of Refined as a product company, identifying synergies across products.
* Work closely with the Design and Engineering teams to address and solve customer problems, ensuring solutions are in line with our strategic vision.

### **In 12 months:**

* Demonstrate a clear ability to prioritize initiatives based on viability, feasibility, and usability within the context of Refined, moving us closer to our vision.
* Implement significant improvements for Refined as a solution builder, that enhance customer satisfaction while driving growth and engagement metrics.

**Why join Refined as a Senior Product Manager?**
-------------------------------------------------

  

In the vibrant tech landscapes of Malmö and Helsinki, we've carved a niche since 2009 as a product-led, organically grown SaaS company. Our culture thrives on the **diversity of thought and experience** brought by our global team, representing 24 nationalities and counting. This melting pot of ideas fuels constant learning, ownership of projects, and our ethos of making things happen.


As a Senior Product Manager, you'll join **a well-established product function** within a company that values freedom, high autonomy, and the principle of "getting it right over being right." Our agile mindset and lack of VC backing mean we're always tackling new challenges, avoiding stagnation, and prioritizing creativity and **rapid iteration to drive better outcomes for our users and ourselves**.

**But it's not all about work.** At Refined, your wellbeing is paramount. We structure our work to ensure flexibility, advocating for a healthy balance that supports life outside of work – be it family time, travel, or other personal passions. Read more about what it’s like to join Refined>>

### **Practicalities, benefits and salary**

* The salary in this role ranges between **52–64 SEK** depending on your know-how. This role would be based in our **Malmö** office.
* Our work is built to be hybrid with team members in different countries. However our Product Management team is based in Malmö and typically works 2-3 days a week in the office. We are looking for candidates who are able to be in the Malmö office 2-3 days a week.
* Twice a year we gather as a whole company to build in-person relationships.
* Full list of benefits can be found here>>

**Interested? Here’s what to do next:**
---------------------------------------

### **Are you the perfect fit for our Senior Product Manager role? Check the list below to see if you have what it takes to succeed:**



* **Strong communication & collaboration skills:** You’re an effective communicator across all management levels and teams; adapting your style to the audience. You are comfortable giving and receiving feedback, and familiar with the radical candor feedback model.
* **Problem-solving mindset:** You make informed decisions balancing features and speed; analyzing data for insights.


* **Project leading skills:** You can plan, document significant work, break down tasks, and lead clear-outcome meetings.


* **Iterative development advocate:** You champion continuous improvement in software development processes.


* **UX focus:** You prioritize user experience in product design and development.
  

We’re looking forward to hearing from you. Don’t hesitate to contact us and learn more about joining our team. If you don’t have any further questions at this point, **apply by November 3, 2024** by leaving your application through this page.


If you’re thinking of applying – we encourage you to do so sooner rather than later, as we will start going through the applications as they come in, and we’re looking to fill this role as soon as we find a mutual fit.

**What to expect after sending in your application?**

* Our Head of People Chloe will be your first point of contact, and will keep you up to date on the process. Should you have any questions, feel free to reach out to Chloe at chloe.nauta@refined.com
* First you will be invited to fill in a pre-screening logic and personality test through our partner Alva Labs.
* The recruitment process will continue with an introductory call, followed by two interviews: one assessing competence and the other evaluating cultural fit.
* Finally, after the discussions, we’ll make you a job offer.
* Welcome to Refined – we are looking forward to working with you!

 *We started Refined in 2009 with a simple idea: Enterprise software doesn’t have to be boring. Since then, Refined has evolved from a handy theming tool into a full-fledged site builder, helping more than 5,000 companies worldwide transform their Atlassian Confluence and Jira instances into beautiful, branded sites users love*

title: Design Lead
description:
### **Job Description**


We are looking for a Visual Design Lead with a keen sense of aesthetics and a strong understanding of UI design, graphic design, and identity design. In this role, you will play a key part in elevating and driving distinctive and consistent UI designs for key brands across the globe. You will be part of a cross-functional design team and focus on creating strong visual digital experiences, while ensuring each brand maintains its unique design expression.


Your responsibilities include unifying and systematizing the visual identity for each brand to be implemented across global products and digital touchpoints, improving recognition and user experience. You will collaborate with global designers and work closely with the Marketing team to develop, maintain, and implement the visual brand identity consistently across all platforms.

**Responsibilities**

* Create, maintain, and evolve visual designs in UI’s and guidelines.
* Ensure a consistent visual language and brand experience across both physical and digital platforms.
* Collaborate with a cross-functional creative team to develop a scalable visual design language that aligns with product and business goals.
* Produce sketches, storyboards, and prototypes to guide the development of product experiences.
* Collaborate on concepts for visuals in various media: illustration, photography, video, animation, etc.
* Contribute to the internal design system.

### **Qualifications**

* A portfolio showcasing strong UI design, graphic design, and identity design experience.
* 7+ years of professional experience as a Visual/Graphic Designer, ideally from a creative agency or in-house team.
* Experience managing and influencing stakeholders across large organizations.
* Strong knowledge of UX principles and how visual design affects user experience.
* Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite and Figma.
* Fluency in graphic design, motion, typography, photography, and illustration.
* Fluent in spoken and written English.

### **Company Description**


Our client is a global leading company that manufactures household appliances to make households easier. If you want to be involved in influencing tomorrow's household appliances, then this is the client for you!

### **When you join JobBusters**


As a consultant at JobBusters, you can feel secure with a collective agreement, available consultant managers and committed recruiters. As a consultant, you also get access to our network of exciting companies and clients! For us, it is important that you as a consultant feel comfortable, feel a sense of security and community with us as an employer. We offer an occupational pension, salary change and the option of flexpension. You also get access to our benefits portal, where in addition to wellness allowance you have access to lots of discounts and offers in wellness, home and leisure, transport, healthcare and much more! Your well-being is of the highest priority for us, and we therefore offer you as an employee Corporate Health Care to deal with all the challenges of everyday life, both at work and in private life.

### **Salary**


As agreed.

### **Admission and Application**


Full-time, office hours. Our client seeks to fill this position immediately and the assignment is expected to continue until 2025-01-31 with the possibility of extension. You will be employed by JobBusters as a consultant for our esteemed client. Please submit your application in English (preferably in Word format) at your earliest convenience, as interviews will be conducted on a rolling basis. Applications received prior to 2024-10-23 will be prioritized in the initial selection process.

title: UX Designer/Strategist
description:
Future colleague!


In your search for the perfect company, fate has led you to **Remotion**, a trailblazing Swedish consulting powerhouse. We're not your ordinary 9-to-5 establishment. Oh no, we're so much more.


At Remotion, we're a diverse blend of dancers, surfers, hunters, actors, football players, and baristas. But don't let our unconventional hobbies fool you. We're also a team of passionate management consultants, performance marketers, growth managers, data scientists, and creatives. Together, we possess an unwavering belief that we've unraveled the secret to driving unparalleled corporate success for companies that need to adapt to the age of digital.  

  

So, if you're ready to embark on an exhilarating journey where innovation knows no bounds, join us at Remotion and become a driving force behind data-driven growth, personalized omnichannel experiences, and performance marketing excellence.

 **We seek**


You are a dedicated UX Designer and Strategist with a passion for creating user-centric experiences. Highly organized and detail-oriented, you approach your work with creativity and an openness to new solutions and tools. Colleagues recognize your ability to translate user needs into effective design strategies and value your curiosity and problem-solving mindset.


You have an strategic mindset and are deeply curious about human behavior and approach design with empathy and inclusivity, always seeking to understand diverse user needs. You focus on details while maintaining a holistic view of the user experience, connecting the dots to identify key challenges. You enjoy exploring user behaviour patterns, forming hypotheses, and developing creative solutions that address real problems.


Collaboration is essential to your design process, and you excel at guiding projects from concept to execution while working closely with cross-functional teams. With proficiency in relevant design and analytic tools, you develop user-focused solutions that align seamlessly with both business goals and user needs.


Your understanding of the relationship between UX and content ensures that your designs are not only functional but also engaging. Committed to quality, you consistently deliver best-in-class work that enhances user experiences and meets client objectives.

 **About the position**


As a UX Designer and Strategist at Remotion, you will enhance our clients' user experience across web and mobile products. Your responsibilities include conducting UX audits, performing user research, and creating intuitive visual solutions. You'll collaborate closely with project managers, content strategists, designers, and developers.


Your primary focus will be identifying user challenges and pain points to improve user satisfaction. You’ll map customer journeys, create empathy maps and personas, and analyze user behavior through tools like Hotjar and Google Analytics. Based on these insights, you’ll provide actionable recommendations for optimizing site structure and user flows, while designing wireframes and mockups in Figma or similar tools. You’ll ensure tha the design meets both user needs and business objectives an also aligned with development capabilities.

 **Examples of work assignments**

* Conduct audits of websites and apps to identify and create strategic recommendations
* Conduct user research through interviews, questionnaires, and usability tests.
* Analyze user data to make informed strategic decisions
* Define user personas and map customer journeys.
* Evaluate navigation and user flows for clarity and effectiveness.
* Create wireframes and mockups for design concepts.

 **Your experience**

* A degree in UX design, human-computer interaction, or a related field.
* 3 – 5 years of professional experience in UX strategy & design
* Ability to analyze user behavior and provide actionable recommendations to improve user journey.
* Proficiency in design tools such as Figma, Adobe XD or similar to create visually compelling designs for web, mobile, and other platforms
* Experience with design systems, UI principles and best practices.
* Proficiency in Hotjar, and Google Analytics
* Experience with CMS platforms like WordPress, Optimizely, or similar systems.
* Understanding of accessibility and WCAG
* Strong problem solving skills, accuracy & strategic mindset.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
* Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
* Familiarity with agile working methods & project management tools such as Trello, Miro, ConceptBoard, etc.
* Integrating AI tools seamlessly into your daily workflow.
* General understanding of SEO fundamentals & tools
* Fluent in spoken and written Swedish and English

 **Extra plus if you...**

* Knowledge on CSS and HTML
* General knowledge/experience in content creation
* Experience in other design tools: Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, AfterEffects
* Experience on SEO Tools such as Semrush, Ahrefs, etc

 **We offer**

* A dynamic organization guided by agile principles, cross-functional teams, and dual leadership.
* A culture that values collective intelligence, self-leadership, and embraces diversity.
* Exciting opportunities for annual international trips, team-building conferences, and dedicated competence development days.

  

This is a project-based position/subcontract. The role is temporary, linked to specific projects with duration and terms tailored to project needs. Ideal for those seeking flexibility and the opportunity to work on diverse and challenging projects in our industry.


In this process, we will require a strong portfolio that highlights your previous work and design solutions, showcasing your expertise. For qualified candidates moving forward, we will assign a small UX assignment/case as a part of our decision making process.

  

Please note that we have a streamlined application process and kindly request that you refrain from sending applications via email. However, if you have any questions or need further information, feel free to reach out to our dedicated contact person for this recruitment process. We eagerly await your application and the chance to connect with you!


Curious to learn more about the Remotion experience? Explore our company in more detail by visiting our website**.**

title: UX/UI Designer för vikariat till Åhléns
description:
Nu söker Åhléns Customer Experience team en vikarierande UX/UI Designer med fokus på research. Teamet, som är en del av Åhléns E-handelsavdelning, har som uppdrag att förbättra kundupplevelsen i samtliga kanaler. Åhléns har en hög ambition att utvecklas inom analys och att skapa en organisation som sätter kunden i fokus och fattar beslut baserat på data.
  
  

Vi erbjuder dig
  
  

Rollen som UX/UI designer innebär att du ansvarar för att iterera kundresan & dess design baserat på research med användarvänlighet och konvertering i fokus. Du kommer tillsammans med dina kollegor inom Customer Experience teamet vara en nyckelspelare i vårt fortsatta arbete kring ökad förståelse för olika kundgruppers behov, beteende och attityder. Du bidrar också i arbetet med att förflytta Åhléns till att bli ett insiktsdrivet företag. I det dagliga arbetet kommer du också att jobba tätt ihop med vårt produktteam.
  
  

**I rollen ingår även att:**  

* Utföra användartester av ny och befintlig design för att identifiera förbättringsområden
* Använda kvantitativ data för att skapa hypoteser kring förbättringar
* Färdigställa UI-design och ansvara för överlämning, specifikationer och kommunikation med utvecklingsteamet
* Kontinuerligt ansvara för designitereringar
* Ansvara för det befintliga designsystemet
* Arrangera workshops, möten med interna kravställare, samt utföra interna presentationer inom produktutveckling


Vem vi söker
  
  

Vi söker dig som brinner för att skapa den bästa kundupplevelsen. Med ett datadrivet angreppssätt arbetar du för att förbättra UX med primärt fokus på en enhetlig och friktionsfri kundresa tillgänglig för alla. Du trivs i en teknisk miljö och är en van att arbeta tillsammans med utvecklare och produktägare. Vana att presentera ditt arbete till övriga intressenter inom organisationen (även på engelska) är också en viktig del av arbetet.
  
  

**Till oss tar du med dig:**  

* Minst tre års erfarenhet av UX- eller produktdesign
* Erfarenhet av Figma
* Erfarenhet av prototypskapande och användartestning
* Underhålla och vidareutveckla design system
* Erfarenhet av webbtillgänglighetsdirektivet


**Meriterande för oss är om du har:**  

* Om du har vana att utveckla i css & html
* Erfarenhet av e-handel
* Vana av agilt arbetssätt
* Erfarenhet av A/B test


Tjänsten är ett vikariat på 8 månader med möjlighet till förlängning. Vi ser gärna att du kan börja så snart som möjligt med placering på Åhléns huvudkontor på Dalagatan i Stockholm.
  
  

Urvalet kan komma att ske löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag, så skicka in din ansökan redan idag.
  
  

Som UX/UI Designer på Åhléns blir du en del av ett passionerat team som drivs av affärsmannaskap och entreprenörskap. Vi ger dig förtroende och möjligheten att växa i en utvecklande miljö. Med det hälsar vi dig varmt välkommen till Åhléns!
  
  

Familjeföretaget Åhléns grundades 1899 i Insjön och är idag ett av Sveriges starkaste varumärken, med 47 varuhus i Sverige och e-handel via åhlens.se. Åhléns är den naturliga mötesplatsen, som ger kunden mervärde och inspirerar till nya upptäckter och möten samt erbjuder en engagerande mix av kvalitetsvarumärken inom kläder, inredning, barnartiklar och skönhet. Åhléns omsätter 4,7 miljarder och varje år tar våra ca 3 000 skickliga medarbetare emot 60 miljoner besökare. Åhléns Outlet och Designtorget är dotterbolag.
  
  

www.ahlens.se
company_description: Åhléns AB, grundat 1899, är ett svenskt detaljhandelsföretag som ingår i Axel Johnson AB.

title: UI/UX-Designer till InfraSight Labs i Malmö
description:
**Forma framtidens plattform för IT Asset Management**
------------------------------------------------------


Vill du designa nästa generations plattform för modern IT-hantering? Som UI/UX Designer hos InfraSight Labs får du arbeta med vår produkt, vScope – en ledande plattform för IT asset management som revolutionerar hur företag arbetar med sin IT. Nu söker vi ytterligare en kollega inom produktdesign till vårt produktteam – Ett drömjobb för dig som har stora ambitioner inom UI/UX och mjukvara!

### **Om InfraSight Labs & vScope**


Vi är ett svenskt mjukvaruföretag i Malmö som utvecklar vScope – marknadens ledande plattform för IT asset management. vScope erbjuder användaren mängder av värdefulla funktioner så som Billing, CMDB, Historik, Analyser och automatiserad rapportering. Men framförallt är vScope bäst på att inventera och kartlägga olika system och tjänster i kundens miljö.


Genom vår egenutvecklade grafdatabasteknologi möjliggör vi våra användare ett helt nytt sätt att jobba tillsammans och med sin IT-dokumentation. Vi är stolta över att ligga i framkant, både när det kommer till teknologi, produkt och kundnöjdhet!

### **Beskrivning av rollen**


Som UX/UI Designer hos InfraSight Labs blir du en nyckelspelare för att fortsätta skapa användarvänliga flöden och vyer i vScope. Du blir våra användares bästa vän och har god insikt i hur olika funktioner bör designas för att passa olika användare, situationer och use-case.

##### **Som UI/UX-Designer kommer du huvudsakligen arbeta med att...**

* Designa intuitiva gränssnitt och flöden som hjälper användaren att navigera och använda vScope på ett begripligt sätt.
* Vara slutanvändarens talesperson i design reviews och diskussioner med produktteamet.
* Arbeta i nära samarbete med utvecklingsteamet och produktägare för att säkerställa att design och upplevelse implementeras korrekt.
* Skapa low-fidelity och high-fidelity prototyper för nya funktioner och förbättringar i produkten.

##### **En typisk arbetsdag kan innehålla:**

* Daglig stand-up för att synka med dina kollegor i utvecklingsteamet.
* Workshops med kunder och användare för att fånga upp saker som hindrar användaren att komma igång, eller att använda produkten.
* Användartester för att validera nya designkoncept.
* Utvärdering och vidareutveckling av vårt designsystem i Figma.
* Nära samarbete med produktägare för att definiera och koordinera framtagning av nya funktioner och koncept i vScope.

### **Vem söker vi?**


Vi söker dig som är redo att ta en central roll i vår produktutveckling där du äger helhetsupplevelsen för hur produkten upplevs och ser ut. Du har en förmåga att tänka strategiskt och har ett öga för detaljer. Du är van vid att arbeta i tvärfunktionella team och har en stark kommunikationsförmåga. Du har några års erfarenhet av att jobba med UX/UI-design inom mjukvara och känner dig redo för nästa steg i karriären.  

  



##### **Kvalifikationer**


Du har en relevant eftergymnasial utbildning inom interaktions-, produkt- eller UX-design. Vi ser även att du:

* Har god erfarenhet av att designa användarvänlig funktionalitet inom mjukvara.
* Har en känsla för form, färg och “bra design”.
* Tar initiativ, ansvarar för ditt arbete och kan arbeta självständigt tillsammans med andra i ett team av duktiga människor.
* Behärskar designverktyg som Figma, Adobe XD eller liknande.
* Kan kommunicera obehindrat på svenska och engelska.

Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av att designa system för att visualisera stora datamängder, grafdatabaser eller liknande. Samt har kunskap om frontend-utveckling (React, TypeScript).

### **Varför InfraSight Labs?**

Hos oss får du chansen att arbeta med marknadens ledande plattform för IT Asset Management. Du får möjlighet att påverka hur företag världen över arbetar med dokumentation, analys och förbättrringar inom IT. Och du får ett erfaret och engagerat team som brinner för mjukvara, bygga produkt och våra kunder.  

  

Låter det spännande? Tveka inte att ansöka redan idag! Skicka med din portfolio så vi får en bild av vad du är duktig på! Vi ser fram emot att välkomna dig som en del av vårt dedikerade team.


Tjänsten tillsätts löpande, så vänta inte med att skicka in din ansökan.

  

#UXUIDesigner #UserExperience #JoinOurTeam #DesignInnovation

title: Software Engineer
description:
### **Responsibilities**


* Develop application in Qt for production test system and ensure functionality/quality of application.
* Develop application in Qt for data transfer for device and ensure functionality/quality of application.
* Support project team with other applications which is developed.
* Ensure set time plan is met.

  


**Requirements**

  


* Experience within application development and working with Qt.
* Competence and experience in programming using Qt and C++.
* Experienced user of troubleshooting with oscilloscope.
* Preferably experience within Life science.
* Understanding of git, continuous integration, test, product integration and troubleshooting skills.
* Knowledge of product development and product lifecycle management.

title: Senior Software Engineer and SRE/DevOps specialist
description:
**Job ID:** 252829


**Date posted:** 24/10/2024


**Why we will love you**  

  

We are on a Digital transformation journey at the iconic IKEA. The Observability team is in charge of developing solutions that focus on application developers and engineers that run infrastructure and services supporting our applications. We are now in need of a passionate and innovative engineer who loves working in an agile environment. You will get the opportunity to influence and expand our SRE practices for our open-source Observability solutions based on the Grafana stack ensuring automation and top-class availability.  

  

Our Context team is at the heart of Operational Intelligence supporting every engineering team at IKEA. The team builds the Observability solution for operational metrics, centralized logging, and distributed tracing for every team at IKEA across multiple global data centres, private and public cloud (GCP, Azure, Alicloud), and many other smaller regions.  

  

REQUIREMENTS  

  

We believe you are a passionate engineer with 5+ years of experience in systems and/or software engineering with proficiency in at least one programming language.  

You understand the importance of a stable and automated service in an operational context for applications end to end observability. SRE mindset and operational experience with Kubernetes and the Grafana LGTM stack is a must. Experience with similar (Splunk, Elastic, SumoLogic, etc ), Observability management products and cloud infrastructure management at scale is beneficial.  

You are inquisitive, innovative, continuously strive to learn new technologies and optimizations of ways of working at the same time as you share your learnings with your colleagues.  

Formal qualifications:  

* Minimum 5 years of professional experience as system or software engineer with similar level of experience in the specific tech stack for the area
* Minimum 3 years of experience of working in agile/iterative software development teams with a DevOps working setup and with an emphasis on self-organisation and delivery to agreed commitments.
* Great understanding of compute, network, and storage infrastructures in cloud environments
* Experience managing Kubernetes clusters and deploying applications using Helm, Kustomize, Tanka
* Expertise in automation and infrastructure-as-code using tools like Terraform, Ansible, Github Actions, Argo CD, GitLab CI, Jenkins to create fully automated configurations and CI/CD pipelines.
* Good understanding of web technologies like HTTP, DNS, PKI, SSL, CDN, WAF
* Hands-on & practical experience of monitoring and observability related to Cloud Platforms (GCP and/or Alicloud), containerized (Docker, Kubernetes) deployments and CI/CD pipelines.
* Strong analytical skills, experience in debugging, code optimization, test
* Demonstrable experience with cloud computing environments
* Excellent written and verbal English communication skills
* Preferred: Knowledge of IKEA Brand, culture, values and way of working

  

Work experience / hands-on skills in the following areas will be an advantage:  

* Experienced in SRE ways of working
* Use of the Grafana stack with Loki, Tempo & Mimir.
* Availability and Capacity management in hybrid deployments
* Good coding skills and experience with Python, TypeScript/JavaScript is required.
* Work planning, tracking and documentation using primarily Markdown, Jira/Confluence, and GitHub.
* A big plus is a verifiable code contribution to open-source projects.
* Open-Telemetry instrumentation insight

  

The IKEA culture and values are very much a part of our business and day to day work life. For you to thrive and grow with IKEA it’s important for us that you share our values! You can read more regarding our values and life at IKEA on our website www.ikea.com.  

  

**Your responsibilities**  

  

When you join us, you will be part of a visionary team managing the architecture, design, and operation of our future at IKEA within the Observability area.  

  

* Together with the team, you will be responsible for the architecture and continued development of our logging, monitoring and event management offerings. Following market trends to explore, research and ensure we always stay on top to create impact and make a difference to all teams at IKEA.
* As an SRE expert, you will collaborate with our operations team and our colleagues in Operational Intelligence on stability and operations for our Observability solution features for complex project requests.
* Use Terraform, Argo CD, Github Actions, and other cloud automation tools to create fully automated CI/CD pipelines with product APIs for integration in our CI/CD tool chain both on-prem, private and public cloud.
* Promote a Product mindset.
* Contribute to improvements in ways of working, encouraging good practices to meet consumer expectations on Product or Service delivery.
* Support design specifications and ensure that Products or Services are aligned, working closely together with other functions to ensure end-to-end business delivery.

  

If you are looking for a possibility to grow, influence our transition, work in an entrepreneurial and innovative environment, this is your chance.  

  

**Together as a team**  

  

We’re a small team working closely with our consumers and OI colleagues. We are quite autonomous, self-organizing and self-sufficient in many ways, which means part of our daily work is to define how we get things done together. We are based in Malmö, Helsingborg, Amsterdam and Dortmund, but a mix of local and remote work is not a problem.  

  

We are passionate about building easy to consume capabilities supporting the need for high-quality data insight in the operational process at IKEA. Giving business and operations team support and insight into availability and performance of critical business applications and infrastructure enables successful delivery of service to our customers. Our close collaborations with development teams enables us to continuously explore new technologies and opportunities.  

We believe a healthy and flexible life balance is important, so together we will strive to create a work environment where you feel in control of your life balance, can be yourself, grow and excel in both your personal and professional life.  

  

**Questions and support? Let's connect!**  

  

The role is based in Sweden (Malmö/Helsingborg) and you will report to Niclas Nilsson  

  

nternal Title: Senior Software Engineer
  

(SRE Specialist)  

  

PLEASE NOTE  

  

Due to GDPR we cant review any applications coming to us in other ways than through our recruitment program.  

  

In this recruitment, there is no relocation support provided by Ikea, hence we are looking for people living in the mentioned location.  

  

If you have any questions about the recruitment process, please connect with the assigned recruiter Linn Hallberg at linn.hallberg@ingka.ikea.com  

  

We will be interviewing continuously so don´t hesitate to send in your application already now.  

  

Looking forward to hearing from you!
